definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: Objective To observe and explore the effect of activating the spleen for the immune function of spleen deficiency rat.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨运脾治疗对脾虚大鼠免疫功能的作用。

sentences.english: Much attention must be paid in clinic to the cancerization trend of gastric disease with Spleen deficiency syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 临床上应高度重视脾虚气滞证胃病的癌变倾向。

sentences.english: Jianpi Tang(Decoction for Reinforcing Spleen)and Yishen Tang(Decoction for Strengthening Kidney)were used to comparatively study on the mice with spleen deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 用健脾汤和益肾汤对脾虚小鼠的疗效作了比较研究。

sentences.english: So it goes to show that "Hugan dripping pill" is an ideal medicine for treating the AFLD.
sentences.chinese: 是治疗肝郁脾虚夹湿热型酒精性脂肪肝理想药物。

sentences.english: Radix Pseudostellariae from Xuanzhou was most effective on spleen-deficiency mice.
sentences.chinese: 其中以安徽宣州太子参改善小鼠脾虚症状效果最好。

sentences.english: To investigate the influence of spleen deficiency on memory.
sentences.chinese: 研究中医脾虚证对大鼠脑记忆功能生化指标的影响。

sentences.english: Objective To develop a specific scale for the chronic hepatitis B patients with spleen deficiency syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索建立慢性乙型肝炎脾虚证候量表的方法。

definition: deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
a person who is in poor health cannot handle sth so strong as a tonic
